summary: A mobile application that converts pathological reports and general doctor prescriptions into standardized, simplified summaries in plain language accessible to non-English speakers. The app will feature a company logo and be designed for mobile use.
architectural_notes: Mobile-first application design targeting non-English speaking users
Core functionality: parse and summarize pathological reports and doctor prescriptions using simplified language
Multilingual output is a key requirement — consider integration with translation APIs
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- MediClear company logo: a clean medical cross icon combined with a speech bubble, rendered in soft green and white on a transparent background (logo.dim_256x256.png)
- Mobile app splash screen background: abstract soft gradient with subtle medical-themed line art (cells, heartbeat line) in muted green and off-white tones (splash-bg.dim_1080x1920.png)

existing_features.title: Design a mobile-first UI with a clean, medical-themed visual identity. Use a calming color palette (e.g., soft greens and whites), clear sans-serif typography, and card-based layouts optimized for small screens. Display a company logo prominently on the home/splash screen and in the top navigation bar consistently across all pages.

Provide an input screen where users can type or paste the text of a pathological lab report and/or a general doctor's prescription into separate labeled text areas. Include a clear 'Convert' or 'Simplify' action button.

Display the generated simplified summary on a dedicated results screen. The summary must be presented in clearly labeled sections (Key Findings, Medications, What To Do Next) with large, readable text. Include a language selector allowing the user to choose their preferred display language from at least: English, Hindi, Spanish, French, Arabic, and Bengali. The section headings and instructional UI text must render in the selected language.

Provide a history screen that lists all previously processed reports in reverse-chronological order. Each list item should show the submission date/time and a short excerpt of the simplified summary. Tapping a history item opens the full simplified summary for that record.

new_feature_requests.summary: Upload or input pathological reports and doctor prescriptions
Convert medical reports into standardized, simplified plain-language summaries
Multilingual support so non-English speakers can understand the summaries
Mobile-first UI with company logo branding

Store submitted reports and their simplified summaries in the backend. Each record should capture: a unique ID, submission timestamp, the original report text, the original prescription text, and the generated simplified summary text.

Implement a report simplification engine in the backend that processes the raw pathological report and prescription text and produces a standardized plain-language summary. The summary must: (a) list key findings in bullet points, (b) translate medical jargon into simple everyday words (e.g., 'hypertension' → 'high blood pressure'), (c) list medications with their purpose and basic dosage instruction in plain terms, and (d) include a 'What to do next' section with actionable steps.
